  <b:defaultmarkup type='ContactForm'>
    <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='contact-form-content'/>
    </b:includable>       
  </b:defaultmarkup>
  <b:defaultmarkup type='Label'>
    <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <div class='widget-content'>
        <b:class expr:name='data:this.display + "-label"'/>
        <b:include cond='data:this.display == "list"' name='list'/>
        <b:include cond='data:this.display == "cloud"' name='cloud'/>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='list'>
      <ul class='list-style'>
        <b:loop values='data:labels' var='label'>
          <li><a class='label-name' expr:href='data:label.url'><data:label.name/><b:if cond='data:this.showFreqNumbers'><b:class name='has-count'/><span class='label-count count-style'>(<data:label.count/>)</span></b:if></a></li>
        </b:loop>
      </ul>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='cloud'>
      <ul class='cloud-style'>
        <b:loop values='data:labels' var='label'>
          <li><a class='label-name btn' expr:href='data:label.url'><data:label.name/><b:if cond='data:this.showFreqNumbers'><b:class name='has-count'/><span class='label-count count-style'>(<data:label.count/>)</span></b:if></a></li>
        </b:loop>
      </ul>
    </b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup>
  <b:defaultmarkup type='FollowByEmail'>
    <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <div class='widget-content'>
		<p>This gadget is no longer available.</p>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup> 
  <b:defaultmarkup type='Image'>
    <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='image-content'/>
    </b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup> 
  <b:defaultmarkup type='BlogArchive'>
    <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <div class='widget-content'>
        <b:class name='archive-list'/>
        <b:include cond='data:this.style in {"FLAT", "MENU", "HIERARCHY"}' name='flat'/>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='flat'>
      <ul class='list-style'>
        <b:loop values='data:data' var='i'>
          <li><a class='archive-name' expr:href='data:i.url'><data:i.name/><b:if cond='data:i.post-count'><b:class name='has-count'/><span class='archive-count count-style'>(<data:i.post-count/>)</span></b:if></a></li>
        </b:loop>
      </ul>
    </b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup>
  <b:defaultmarkup type='PageList'>
    <b:includable id='main'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='pagelist-content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='overflowButton'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
    <b:includable id='overflowablePageList'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
    <b:includable id='pageLink'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
    <b:includable id='pageList'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup>
  <b:defaultmarkup type='BlogSearch'>
    <b:includable id='main'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='searchForm'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='searchForm'>
      <form class='search-form' expr:action='data:blog.searchUrl'>
        <b:attr cond='!data:view.isPreview' name='target' value='_top'/>
        <b:include name='urlParamsAsFormInput'/>
        <input autocomplete='off' class='search-input' expr:aria-label='data:messages.search' expr:placeholder='data:messages.search' name='q' type='search' value=''/>
        <b:include name='searchSubmit'/>
      </form>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='searchSubmit'>
      <input class='search-action btn' expr:value='data:messages.ok' type='submit'/>
    </b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup>
  <b:defaultmarkup type='Profile'>
    <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='authorProfileImage' var='this'>
      <img class='profile-img' expr:alt='data:messages.myPhoto' expr:src='resizeImage(data:authorPhoto.image, 50, "1:1")'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='defaultProfileImage' var='this'>
      <img class='profile-img' expr:alt='data:messages.myPhoto' src='https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QN2lgvtYZco/YN3mUSryAVI/AAAAAAAAADs/KrR-etCcvUMcPl06jopTs9pzq59IAXhMQCLcBGAsYHQ/w50-h50-p-k-no-nu/avatar.jpg'/>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='userProfileInfo' var='this'>
      <div class='profile-info'>
        <dl class='profile-datablock'>
          <b:include name='userProfileData'/>
        </dl>
        <b:include name='viewProfileLink'/>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='teamProfileLink' var='this'>
      <b:include name='profileImage'/>
      <div class='profile-info'>
        <a class='profile-name' expr:href='data:userUrl' rel='noopener nofollow' target='_blank'><data:display-name/></a>
        <a class='profile-link' expr:href='data:userUrl' rel='noopener nofollow' target='_blank'><data:messages.showMore/></a>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='userProfile' var='this'>
      <b:include name='profileImage'/>
      <div class='profile-info'>
        <a class='profile-name' expr:href='data:userUrl' rel='noopener nofollow' target='_blank'><data:displayname/></a>
        <a class='profile-link' expr:href='data:userUrl' rel='noopener nofollow' target='_blank'><data:messages.showMore/></a>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
  </b:defaultmarkup>
</b:defaultmarkups>
</head>
<body>
<b:include name='theme-body-class'/>
<b:if cond='data:view.isLayoutMode or (data:widgets any w => w.sectionId == "pbt-panel")'>
  <div id='theme-options' style='display:none'>
    <b:section class='pbt-panel' id='pbt-panel' maxwidgets='2' name='Theme Options' showaddelement='no'>
      <b:widget id='Image52' locked='true' title='Default Thumbnail' type='Image' visible='false'>
        <b:widget-settings>
          <b:widget-setting name='displayUrl'>https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rI4UCIrwEI4/YN3nGkf0nCI/AAAAAAAAAD0/DQ6fW7eCps8NL7S0oh374KFg1MsWUf2GQCLcBGAsYHQ/s72-c/ptb-nth.png</b:widget-setting>
          <b:widget-setting name='displayHeight'>72</b:widget-setting>
          <b:widget-setting name='sectionWidth'>150</b:widget-setting>
          <b:widget-setting name='shrinkToFit'>false</b:widget-setting>
          <b:widget-setting name='displayWidth'>72</b:widget-setting>
          <b:widget-setting name='link'/>
          <b:widget-setting name='caption'/>
        </b:widget-settings>
        <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
        <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='image-content'/>
    </b:includable>
      </b:widget>
      <b:widget id='HTML50' locked='true' title='JSON Variables' type='HTML' visible='true'>
        <b:widget-settings>
          <b:widget-setting name='content'/>
        </b:widget-settings>
        <b:includable id='main'>
      <b:include name='html-content'/>
    </b:includable>
      </b:widget>
    </b:section>
  </div>
</b:if>
<div id='outer-wrapper'>
  <header id='header-wrapper'>
    <b:if cond='data:widgets any w => w.sectionId == "topbar"'>
      <nav class='topbar-wrap flex-c'>
        <b:class cond='data:widgets.PageList none w => w.sectionId == "topbar"' name='no-topbar-menu'/>
        <div class='container row-x1'>
          <b:section class='topbar flex-sb' id='topbar' maxwidgets='2' name='Topbar' showaddelement='yes'>
            <b:widget id='PageList51' locked='true' title='Pages' type='PageList' visible='false'>
              <b:widget-settings>
                <b:widget-setting name='pageListJson'><![CDATA[{"link1":{"href":"#","position":1,"title":"About Us"},"link0":{"href":"/","position":0,"title":"Home"},"link3":{"href":"#","position":3,"title":"Contact Us"},"link2":{"href":"#","position":2,"title":"Privacy Policy"}}]]></b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='homeTitle'>Home</b:widget-setting>
              </b:widget-settings>
              <b:includable id='main'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
              <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='pagelist-content'/>
    </b:includable>
              <b:includable id='overflowButton'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
              <b:includable id='overflowablePageList'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
              <b:includable id='pageLink'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
              <b:includable id='pageList'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            </b:widget>
            <b:widget id='LinkList50' locked='true' title='Follow Us' type='LinkList' visible='false'>
              <b:widget-settings>
                <b:widget-setting name='link-3'>#</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='sorting'>NONE</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='text-1'>twitter</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='link-1'>#</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='text-0'>facebook</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='link-2'>#</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='text-3'>pinterest</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='link-0'>#</b:widget-setting>
                <b:widget-setting name='text-2'>youtube</b:widget-setting>
              </b:widget-settings>
              <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
              <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='linklist-content'/>
    </b:includable>
            </b:widget>
          </b:section>
        </div>
      </nav>
    </b:if>
    <div class='main-header'>
      <div class='header-inner'>
        <div class='header-header flex-c'>
          <div class='container row-x1'>
            <div class='header-items'>
              <div class='flex-left'>
                <b:tag class='mobile-menu-toggle' href='#' name='a' role='button' title='Menu'/>
                <b:if cond='data:view.isLayoutMode or (data:widgets.Image any w => w.sectionId == "main-logo")'>
                  <b:section class='main-logo' id='main-logo' maxwidgets='1' name='Header Logo' showaddelement='no'>
                    <b:widget id='Image50' locked='true' title='' type='Image' visible='false'>
                      <b:widget-settings>
                        <b:widget-setting name='displayUrl'>https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/a/AVvXsEi2M_Rq30hDJwjESPvYU1GMnkJ7tSknv8XrvbtfmmSMEVxXg_ngOE8dspCFO3lRMXuITP4XhJnyZqMFiDx6HI3I5dW5TxGbpHh_DFfO8VM_pVcM4mi5_ZEnxO_QODrZ-JudRiPAZGnloL6ubRW6u4txefBNt5NaClcQil7S8T2e1166Nwmsh0cvW2m8wEUt=s500</b:widget-setting>
                        <b:widget-setting name='displayHeight'>500</b:widget-setting>
                        <b:widget-setting name='sectionWidth'>150</b:widget-setting>
                        <b:widget-setting name='shrinkToFit'>false</b:widget-setting>
                        <b:widget-setting name='displayWidth'>500</b:widget-setting>
                        <b:widget-setting name='link'/>
                        <b:widget-setting name='caption'/>
                      </b:widget-settings>
                      <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
                      <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='image-content'/>
    </b:includable>
                    </b:widget>
                  </b:section>
                <b:else/>
                  <div class='main-logo'>
                    <b:tag class='title' expr:name='data:view.isMultipleItems ? "h1" : "span"'>
                      <a class='homepage' expr:href='data:blog.homepageUrl.canonical' rel='home'><data:blog.title/></a>
                    </b:tag>
                  </div>
                </b:if>
                <b:section class='newspot-free-main-nav' id='newspot-free-main-nav' maxwidgets='1' name='Header Menu' showaddelement='no'>
                  <b:widget id='PageList50' locked='true' title='Pages' type='PageList' visible='true'>
                    <b:widget-settings>
                      <b:widget-setting name='pageListJson'><![CDATA[{"0":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/","position":0,"title":"Home"},"1660158633497094629":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/p/privacy-policy.html","position":3,"title":"Privacy policy"},"link1":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/search?q=telecom","position":2,"title":"Telecom"},"link0":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/search?q=banking","position":1,"title":"Banking "},"194761927504349459":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/p/sitemap.html","position":4,"title":"Sitemap"},"3153270458771269824":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/p/contact-us_15.html","position":6,"title":"Contact us"},"2065077008213849612":{"href":"https://techatalphor.blogspot.com/p/about-us.html","position":5,"title":"About us"}}]]></b:widget-setting>
                      <b:widget-setting name='homeTitle'>Home</b:widget-setting>
                    </b:widget-settings>
                    <b:includable id='main'>
      <b:include name='widget-title'/>
      <b:include name='content'/>
    </b:includable>
                    <b:includable id='content'>
      <b:include name='pagelist-content'/>
    </b:includable>
                    <b:includable id='overflowButton'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
                    <b:includable id='overflowablePageList'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
                    <b:includable id='pageLink'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
                    <b:includable id='pageList'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
                  </b:widget>
                </b:section>
              </div>
              <div class='flex-right'>
                <div class='toggle-wrap'>
                  <b:tag class='search-toggle show-search' expr:title='data:messages.search' href='#' name='a' role='button'/>
                </div>
              </div>
              <div id='main-search-wrap'>
                <div class='main-search'>
                  <form class='search-form' expr:action='data:blog.searchUrl'>
                    <b:attr cond='!data:view.isPreview' name='target' value='_top'/>
                    <input autocomplete='off' class='search-input' expr:aria-label='data:messages.search' expr:placeholder='data:messages.search' name='q' type='search' value=''/>
                    <button class='search-toggle search-close' type='reset' value=''/>
                  </form>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </header>
  <div class='flex-c' id='content-wrapper'>
    <div class='container row-x1 flex-sb'>
      <main id='main-wrapper'>
        <b:section class='main' id='main' maxwidgets='1' name='Main Posts' showaddelement='yes'>
          <b:widget id='Blog1' locked='true' title='Blog Posts' type='Blog' visible='true'>
            <b:widget-settings>
              <b:widget-setting name='showDateHeader'>false</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='commentLabel'>$type={blogger}</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.textcolor'>#ffffff</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showShareButtons'>true</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='authorLabel'>by</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showCommentLink'>true</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.urlcolor'>#ffffff</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showAuthor'>true</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.linkcolor'>#ffffff</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.unittype'>TextAndImage</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.bgcolor'>#ffffff</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='timestampLabel'>-</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='reactionsLabel'/>
              <b:widget-setting name='showAuthorProfile'>false</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.layout'>1x1</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showLabels'>true</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showLocation'>false</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='postLabelsLabel'>Tags</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showTimestamp'>true</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='postsPerAd'>1</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showBacklinks'>false</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='style.bordercolor'>#ffffff</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showInlineAds'>false</b:widget-setting>
              <b:widget-setting name='showReactions'>false</b:widget-setting>
            </b:widget-settings>
            <b:includable id='main' var='this'>
      <b:class cond='data:view.isMultipleItems' name='flex-col'/>
      <b:include cond='data:view.isHomepage' name='blogPostsTitle'/>
      <b:include name='searchMessage'/>
      <b:if cond='!data:posts.empty'>
        <div class='blog-posts'>
          <b:class cond='data:view.isMultipleItems' name='index-post-wrap flex-col'/>
          <b:class cond='data:view.isSingleItem' name='item-post-wrap flex-col'/>
          <b:loop index='i' values='data:posts' var='post'>
            <b:include data='post' name='postCommentsAndAd'/>
          </b:loop>
        </div>
        <b:include cond='data:view.isMultipleItems' name='ajaxPagination'/>
      </b:if>
      <b:include name='feedLinks'/>
      <b:include name='exportBlogContent'/>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='aboutPostAuthor'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='addComments'>
      <a expr:href='data:post.commentsUrl' expr:onclick='data:post.commentsUrlOnclick'><data:messages.postAComment/></a>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='ajaxPagination'>
      <!-- Ajax Pagination on Index -->
      <div class='blog-pager' id='blog-pager'>
        <b:if cond='data:olderPageUrl'>
          <a class='blog-pager-older-link load-more' expr:data-load='data:olderPageUrl.canonical' href='#' id='newspot-free-load-more-link'><b:include data='{ message: "loadMorePosts" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/></a>
          <span class='loading'><div class='loader'/></span>
          <span class='no-more load-more'><b:include data='{ message: "noMorePosts" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/></span>
          <b:else/>
          <span class='no-more load-more show'><b:include data='{ message: "noMorePosts" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/></span>
        </b:if>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='backLinks' var='post'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='blogPostsTitle'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='blogThisShare'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='bylineByName' var='byline'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='bylineRegion' var='regionItems'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentAuthorAvatar'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentDeleteIcon' var='comment'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentForm' var='post'>
      <div class='comment-form'>
        <a name='comment-form'/>
        <b:include data='post' name='commentFormIframeSrc'/>
        <iframe allowtransparency='allowtransparency' class='blogger-iframe-colorize blogger-comment-from-post' frameborder='0' height='90px' id='comment-editor' name='comment-editor' src='' width='100%'/>
        <data:post.cmtfpIframe/>
        <script type='text/javascript'>
          BLOG_CMT_createIframe('<data:post.appRpcRelayPath/>');
        </script>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentFormIframeSrc' var='post'>
      <a expr:href='data:post.commentFormIframeSrc + "&skin=soho"' id='comment-editor-src' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Comment Form Link'/>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentItem' var='comment'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentList' var='comments'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentPicker' var='post'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='comments' var='post'>
      <a name='comments'/>
      <b:include name='commentsTitle'/>
      <section class='comments threaded flex-col' expr:data-embed='data:post.embedCommentForm' expr:data-num-comments='data:post.numberOfComments' id='comments'>
        <b:class expr:name='data:post.numberOfComments != 0 ? "has-comments" : "no-comments"'/>
        <b:if cond='data:post.allowNewComments'>
          <b:if cond='data:this.messages.blogComment'><p class='comments-message excerpt'><data:this.messages.blogComment/></p></b:if>
          <b:else/>
          <b:if cond='data:post.noNewCommentsText and (data:post.numberOfComments == 0)'><p class='comments-message no-new-comments excerpt'><data:post.noNewCommentsText/><em>*</em></p></b:if>
        </b:if>
        <b:if cond='data:post.embedCommentForm'>
          <b:if cond='data:post.numberOfComments != 0'>
            <div class='comments-content'>
              <div id='comment-holder'>
                <data:post.commentHtml/>
              </div>
            </div>
          </b:if>
          <b:if cond='data:post.allowNewComments'>
            <b:include data='post' name='commentForm'/>
          </b:if>
          <b:if cond='!data:post.allowNewComments'><b:if cond='data:post.noNewCommentsText and (data:post.numberOfComments != 0)'><p class='comments-message no-new-comments excerpt'><data:post.noNewCommentsText/><em>*</em></p></b:if></b:if>
          <b:else/>
          <p class='comments-message excerpt'>Please Select Embedded Mode To Show The Comment System.<em>*</em></p>
        </b:if>
      </section>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='commentsTitle'>
      <!-- Comments Title -->
      <div class='title-wrap comments-title'><b:class expr:name='data:this.messages.blogComment ? "has-message" : "no-message"'/><h3 class='title'><b:if cond='data:post.numberOfComments != 0'><data:post.numberOfComments/> <data:messages.comments/><b:else/><data:messages.postAComment/></b:if></h3></div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='defaultAdUnit'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='emailPostIcon'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='exportBlogContent'>
      <b:tag name='script' type='text/javascript'>
      var pbtMessages = {
      noTitle: "<data:messages.noTitle/>",
      viewAll: "<data:messages.viewAll/>",
      postAuthor: <b:eval expr='data:allBylineItems.author ? "true" : "false"'/>,
      postAuthorLabel: "<b:eval expr='data:allBylineItems.author.label ? data:allBylineItems.author.label : ""'/>",
      postDate: <b:eval expr='data:allBylineItems.timestamp ? "true" : "false"'/>,
      postDateLabel: "<b:eval expr='data:allBylineItems.timestamp.label ? data:allBylineItems.timestamp.label : ""'/>"
      }
      </b:tag>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='facebookShare'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='feedLinks'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='feedLinksBody' var='links'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='footerBylines'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='googlePlusShare'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='headerByline' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Entry Meta -->
      <b:if cond='data:view.isMultipleItems'>
        <b:if cond='data:allBylineItems.author or data:allBylineItems.timestamp'>
          <div class='entry-meta'>
            <b:include cond='data:allBylineItems.author' data='post' name='postAuthor'/>
            <b:include cond='data:allBylineItems.timestamp' data='post' name='postTimestamp'/>
          </div>
        </b:if>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isPost'>
        <b:if cond='data:allBylineItems.author or data:allBylineItems.timestamp'>
          <b:class name='has-meta'/>
          <div class='entry-meta'>
            <div class='align-left'>
              <b:include cond='data:allBylineItems.author' data='post' name='postAuthor'/>
              <b:include cond='data:allBylineItems.timestamp' data='post' name='postTimestamp'/>
            </div>
            <b:if cond='data:allBylineItems.comments'>
              <div class='align-right'>
                <b:include cond='data:allBylineItems.comments' data='post' name='postCommentsLink'/>
              </div>
            </b:if>
          </div>
        </b:if>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='homePageLink'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='iframeComments' var='post'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='indexPost' var='post'>
      <!-- Index Post Content -->
      <b:include data='post' name='postFeaturedImage'/>
      <div class='entry-header'>
        <b:include data='post' name='postHeader'/>
        <b:include data='post' name='headerByline'/>
        <b:include data='post' name='postBodySnippet'/>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='inlineAd' var='post'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='itemPost' var='post'>
      <!-- Item Post Content -->
      <b:include data='post' name='postMeta'/>
      <div class='item-post-inner flex-col'>
        <div class='entry-header p-eh'>
          <b:include data='post' name='postHeader'/>
        </div>
        <div class='entry-content-wrap flex-col'>
          <b:include data='post' name='postBody'/>
          <b:include cond='data:view.isPost and data:allBylineItems.labels' data='post' name='postLabels'/>
          <b:include cond='data:view.isPost and data:allBylineItems.share' data='post' name='postShareButtons'/>
        </div>
      </div>
      <b:include cond='data:view.isPost' data='post' name='postFooter'/>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='linkShare'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='nextPageLink'>
      <b:if cond='data:olderPageUrl'>
        <a class='post-nav-link post-nav-older-link' expr:href='data:olderPageUrl.canonical'>
          <b:include data='{ message: "nextPost" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/>
        </a>
        <b:else/>
        <span class='post-nav-link post-nav-older-link'>
          <b:include data='{ message: "nextPost" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/>
        </span>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='otherSharingButton'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='platformShare'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='post' var='post'>
      <!-- Index Posts -->
      <b:if cond='data:view.isMultipleItems'>
        <b:include data='post' name='indexPost'/>
      </b:if>
      <!-- Item Post -->
      <b:if cond='data:view.isSingleItem'>
        <b:include data='post' name='itemPost'/>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postAuthor' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Author -->
      <span class='entry-author mi'><b:if cond='data:view.isPost'><span class='author-avatar-wrap'><span class='author-avatar' expr:data-image='data:post.author.authorPhoto.image ? resizeImage(data:post.author.authorPhoto.image, 72, "1:1") : "https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QN2lgvtYZco/YN3mUSryAVI/AAAAAAAAADs/KrR-etCcvUMcPl06jopTs9pzq59IAXhMQCLcBGAsYHQ/s72-c/avatar.jpg"'/></span></b:if><b:if cond='data:allBylineItems.author.label'><span class='by sp'><data:allBylineItems.author.label/></span></b:if><span class='author-name'><data:post.author.name/></span></span>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postBody' var='post'> 
      <!-- Post Body Entry Content-->
      <div class='post-body entry-content' id='post-body'>
        <data:post.body/>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postBodySnippet' var='post'><p class='entry-excerpt excerpt'><b:eval expr='data:post.snippets.long snippet { length: 97 }'/></p></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postBreadcrumbs' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Breadcrumbs -->
      <b:if cond='data:view.isPost'>
        <b:if cond='data:skin.vars.breadcrumb == "1px"'><nav id='breadcrumb'><a class='home' expr:href='data:blog.homepageUrl'><data:messages.home/></a><b:if cond='data:post.labels'><em class='separator'/><a class='label' expr:href='data:post.labels.first.url'><data:post.labels.first.name/></a></b:if></nav></b:if>
        <script type='application/ld+json'>{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"name":"<data:messages.home.jsonEscaped/>","item":"<data:blog.homepageUrl.canonical.jsonEscaped/>"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"name":"<b:if cond='data:post.labels'><data:post.labels.first.name.jsonEscaped/><b:else/><data:messages.posts/></b:if>","item":"<b:if cond='data:post.labels'><data:post.labels.first.url.canonical.jsonEscaped/><b:else/><b:eval expr='data:blog.homepageUrl.canonical.jsonEscaped + "search/"'/></b:if>"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"name":"<data:post.title.jsonEscaped/>","item":"<data:post.url.canonical.jsonEscaped/>"}]}</script>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isPage'>
        <script type='application/ld+json'>{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"name":"<data:messages.home.jsonEscaped/>","item":"<data:blog.homepageUrl.canonical.jsonEscaped/>"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"name":"<data:post.title.jsonEscaped/>","item":"<data:post.url.canonical.jsonEscaped/>"}]}</script>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postCategory' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Label -->
      <b:if cond='data:post.labels'><span class='entry-category'><data:post.labels.first.name/></span></b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postCommentsAndAd' var='post'>
      <article class='blog-post hentry'>
        <b:class cond='data:view.isMultipleItems' expr:name='"index-post post-" + data:i'/>
        <b:class cond='data:view.isSingleItem' name='item-post flex-col'/>
        <b:include data='post' name='post'/>
      </article>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isSingleItem and data:post.allowComments'>
        <!-- Post Comments -->
        <div class='newspot-free-blog-post-comments post-widget' expr:data-shortcode='data:allBylineItems.comments.label contains "type" ? data:allBylineItems.comments.label : "$type={blogger}"'>
          <b:include data='post' name='threadedCommentsDisqus'/>
          <b:include data='post' name='comments'/>
        </div>
      </b:if>
      <!-- Post Navigation -->
      <b:include cond='data:skin.vars.postnav == "1px"' name='postPagination'/>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postCommentsLink'>
      <b:if cond='data:skin.vars.cmm_count == "1px"'>
        <!-- Post Comments Count -->
        <span class='entry-comments-link'><data:post.numberOfComments/></span>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postFeaturedImage' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Featured Image -->
      <a class='entry-image-wrap' expr:href='data:post.url.canonical' expr:title='data:post.title ? data:post.title : data:messages.noTitle'><b:if cond='data:post.featuredImage'><span class='entry-image' expr:data-image='data:post.featuredImage.isYouTube ? resizeImage(data:post.featuredImage.youtubeMaxResDefaultUrl.jsonEscaped, 72, "1:1") : resizeImage(data:post.featuredImage, 72, "1:1")'/><b:else/><span class='entry-image' data-image='https://resources.blogblog.com/img/blank.gif'/></b:if><b:class expr:name='data:post.featuredImage.isYouTube ? "is-video" : "is-image"'/><b:include data='post' name='postCategory'/></a>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postFooter' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Footer Items -->
      <b:tag class='post-footer flex-col' cond='data:post.author.aboutMe or (data:widgets.HTML any w => w.sectionId == "newspot-free-related-posts")' name='footer'>
        <b:include cond='data:post.author.aboutMe' data='post' name='postFooterAuthorProfile'/>
        <b:include cond='data:widgets.HTML any w => w.sectionId == "newspot-free-related-posts"' data='post' name='relatedPosts'/>
      </b:tag>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postFooterAuthorProfile' var='post'>
      <div class='about-author post-widget'>
        <div class='author-avatar-wrap'>
          <span class='author-avatar' expr:data-image='data:post.author.authorPhoto.image ? resizeImage(data:post.author.authorPhoto.image, 72, "1:1") : "https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QN2lgvtYZco/YN3mUSryAVI/AAAAAAAAADs/KrR-etCcvUMcPl06jopTs9pzq59IAXhMQCLcBGAsYHQ/s72-c/avatar.jpg"'/>
        </div>
        <div class='author-description flex-col'>
          <h3 class='author-title'><b:tag cond='data:post.author.profileUrl' expr:alt='data:post.author.name' expr:href='data:post.author.profileUrl' name='a' rel='noopener noreferrer' target='_blank'><data:post.author.name/></b:tag></h3>
          <p class='author-text excerpt'><data:post.author.aboutMe/></p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postHeader' var='post'>
      <b:include cond='data:view.isSingleItem' data='post' name='postBreadcrumbs'/>
      <b:include data='post' name='postTitle'/>
      <b:include cond='data:view.isPost' data='post' name='headerByline'/>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postJumpLink' var='post'>
      <b:if cond='data:blog.jumpLinkMessage != "hide"'>
        <a class='read-more' expr:href='data:post.url.canonical'><data:blog.jumpLinkMessage/></a>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postLabels' var='post'>
      <b:if cond='data:post.labels'>
        <div class='entry-labels'>
          <b:if cond='data:allBylineItems.labels.label'><span class='labels-label btn'><data:allBylineItems.labels.label/></span></b:if>
          <b:loop values='data:post.labels' var='label'>
            <a class='label-link btn' expr:href='data:label.url' rel='tag'><data:label.name/></a>
          </b:loop>
        </div>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postLocation'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postMeta' var='post'>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isPost'>
        <script type='application/ld+json'>{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"<data:post.url.canonical.jsonEscaped/>"},"headline":"<data:post.title.jsonEscaped/>","description":"<data:post.snippets.short.jsonEscaped/>","datePublished":"<data:post.date.iso8601.jsonEscaped/>","dateModified":"<data:post.lastUpdated.iso8601.jsonEscaped/>","image":{"@type":"ImageObject",<b:if cond='data:post.featuredImage.isResizable'>"url":"<b:eval expr='resizeImage(data:post.featuredImage, 1200, "1200:675")'/>","height":675,"width":1200<b:else/>"url":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ULB6iBuCeTVvSjjjU1A-O8e9ZpVba6uvyhtiWRti_rBAs9yMYOFBujxriJRZ-A=w1200","height":348,"width":1200</b:if>},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"<data:post.author.name.jsonEscaped/>"},"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Blogger","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ULB6iBuCeTVvSjjjU1A-O8e9ZpVba6uvyhtiWRti_rBAs9yMYOFBujxriJRZ-A=h60","width":206,"height":60}}}</script>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postMetadataJSONImage'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postMetadataJSONPublisher'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postPagination'>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isPost'>
        <div class='post-nav post-widget'>
          <b:include name='previousPageLink'/>
          <b:include name='nextPageLink'/>
        </div>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postReactions'><b:comment>Removed</b:comment></b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postShareButtons' var='post'>
      <!-- Post ShareButtons -->
      <div class='post-share'>
        <ul class='share-links social social-bg'>
          <li class='facebook has-span'><a class='fa-facebook btn pbt-window' data-height='500' data-width='520' expr:data-url='"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=" + data:post.url.canonical' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Facebook'><span>Facebook</span></a></li>
          <li class='twitter has-span'><a class='fa-twitter btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=" + data:post.url.canonical + "&text=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Twitter'><span>Twitter</span></a></li>
          <li class='whatsapp'><a class='fa-whatsapp btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://api.whatsapp.com/send?text=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped + " | " + data:post.url.canonical' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='WhatsApp'/></li>
          <li class='pinterest-p'><a class='fa-pinterest-p btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=" + data:post.url.canonical + "&media=" + data:post.featuredImage + "&description=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Pinterest'/></li>
          <li class='linkedin'><a class='fa-linkedin-in btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=" + data:post.url.canonical + "&title=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='LinkedIn'/></li>
          <li class='reddit'><a class='fa-reddit-alien btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://reddit.com/submit?url=" + data:post.url.canonical + "&title=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Reddit'/></li>
          <li class='tumblr'><a class='fa-tumblr btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://www.tumblr.com/share/link?url=" + data:post.url.canonical + "&name=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Tumblr'/></li>
          <li class='telegram'><a class='fa-telegram-plane btn pbt-window' data-height='520' data-width='860' expr:data-url='"https://telegram.me/share/url?url=" + data:post.url.canonical + "&text=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Telegram'/></li>
          <li class='email'><a class='fa-email btn pbt-window' data-height='500' data-width='520' expr:data-url='"mailto:?subject=" + data:post.title.jsEscaped + "&body=" + data:post.url.canonical' href='#' rel='noopener noreferrer' title='Email'/></li>
          <li class='show-hid'><a class='btn' expr:title='data:messages.showMore' href='#' rel='nofollow'/></li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postTimestamp' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Timestamp -->
      <span class='entry-time mi'><b:if cond='data:allBylineItems.author and data:allBylineItems.timestamp.label'><span class='sp'><data:allBylineItems.timestamp.label/></span></b:if><time class='published' expr:datetime='data:post.date.iso8601'><data:post.date/></time></span>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='postTitle' var='post'>
      <!-- Post Title Index and Item -->
      <b:if cond='data:view.isMultipleItems'>
        <h2 class='entry-title'><a expr:href='data:post.url.canonical' expr:title='data:post.title ? data:post.title : data:messages.noTitle' rel='bookmark'><b:eval expr='data:post.title ? data:post.title : data:messages.noTitle'/></a></h2>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isSingleItem'>
        <h1 class='entry-title'><b:eval expr='data:post.title ? data:post.title : data:messages.noTitle'/></h1>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='previousPageLink'>
      <b:if cond='data:newerPageUrl'>
        <a class='post-nav-link post-nav-newer-link' expr:href='data:newerPageUrl.canonical'>
          <b:include data='{ message: "prevPost" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/>
        </a>
        <b:else/>
        <span class='post-nav-link post-nav-newer-link'>
          <b:include data='{ message: "prevPost" }' name='theme-custom-lang'/>
        </span>
      </b:if>
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='relatedPosts' var='post'>
      <!-- Related Posts -->
      <div class='post-widget' id='related-wrap'>
        <div class='title-wrap related-title'>
          <h3 class='title'><span class='t-text'><data:messages.youMayLikeThesePosts/></span></h3>
        </div>
        <div class='related-content'>
          <b:if cond='data:post.labels'>
            <div class='related-tag' expr:data-id='data:post.id' expr:data-label='data:post.labels.first.name'/>
            <b:else/>
            <div class='related-tag' data-label='recent' expr:data-id='data:post.id'/>
          </b:if>
        </div> 
      </div>  
    </b:includable>
            <b:includable id='searchMessage'>
      <!-- Search Message -->
      <b:if cond='data:posts.empty'>
        <b:class name='no-posts'/>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.search.query'>
        <div class='queryMessage'>
          <b:if cond='data:posts.empty'>
            <span class='query-info query-error'>"<data:view.search.query/>"</span>
            <b:else/>
            <span class='query-info query-success'>"<data:view.search.query/>"</span>
          </b:if>
        </div>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.search.label'>
        <div class='queryMessage '>
          <b:if cond='data:posts.empty'>
            <span class='query-info query-label query-error'><data:view.search.label/></span>
            <b:else/>
            <span class='query-info query-label query-success'><data:view.search.label/></span>
          </b:if>
        </div>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isArchive'>
        <div class='queryMessage'>
          <b:if cond='data:posts.empty'>
            <span class='query-info query-error'><data:view.archive.rangeMessage/></span>
            <b:else/>
            <span class='query-info query-success'><data:view.archive.rangeMessage/></span>
          </b:if>
        </div>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isError'>
        <div class='errorWrap'>
          <h3>404</h3>
          <h4><data:messages.theresNothingHere/></h4>
          <p><data:navMessage/></p>
          <a class='homepage btn' expr:href='data:blog.homepageUrl'><data:messages.home/></a>
        </div>
      </b:if>
      <b:if cond='data:view.isMultipleItems and data:posts.empty'><div class='queryEmpty'><data:messages.noResultsFound/></div></b:if>
    </b:includable>

          </div>
        </a>

Usually sitemap can be generated by some tools and we have to pay for that tools. according to us there  is no need to pay for sitemap. simply you can generate sitemap by entering or joining an url in a browser. Below there will be some points to generate xml and Html sitemap.

entry.title: List of alternatives for kodi
entry.content:
There are several alternatives to Kodi for media playback and streaming. The best alternative for you depends on your specific needs and preferences. Here are some popular options:


1. Plex:

   - Plex is a media server and player that organizes your media and allows you to stream it to various devices.

   - It offers a user-friendly interface and supports a wide range of platforms.


2. Emby:

   - Similar to Plex, Emby is a media server that organizes and streams your media content.

   - It provides features like live TV support, parental controls, and more.


3. Jellyfin:

   - Jellyfin is an open-source alternative to Plex and Emby.

   - It allows you to organize, stream, and share your media with an emphasis on privacy and open-source principles.


4. Popcorn Time:

   - Popcorn Time is a free, open-source application for streaming movies and TV shows.

   - It uses BitTorrent technology to provide a smooth streaming experience.


5. Stremio:

   - Stremio is a media center that allows you to organize and watch video content from different sources.

   - It supports add-ons to expand its functionality.


6. Infuse:

   - Infuse is a media player designed for iOS and Apple TV.

   - It supports a wide range of video formats and has a sleek interface.


7. Universal Media Server:

   - Universal Media Server is a free, open-source media server that streams media to devices like smart TVs, gaming consoles, and more.

   - It supports a variety of devices and formats.


8. Kodi Forks:

   - Some developers create customized versions or forks of Kodi with specific features or modifications. Examples include SPMC (Semper Media Center) and OSMC (Open Source Media Center).


When choosing an alternative to Kodi, consider factors such as platform support, user interface, features, and your specific media consumption needs. Test a few options to see which one best suits your preferences and requirements.

entry.title: Html code to create privacy policy generator website
entry.content:
<html>
<head>
    <title>Your website name</title>
</head>
<body>
    <h1>Privacy Policy Generator</h1>
    <p>Fill out the form to generate a privacy policy for your website:</p>

    <form id="privacyPolicyForm">
        <label for="websiteName">Website Name:</label>
        <input id="websiteName" required="" type="text" /><br />

        <label for="websiteURL">Website URL:</label>
        <input id="websiteURL" required="" type="url" /><br />

        <label for="contactEmail">Contact Email:</label>
        <input id="contactEmail" required="" type="email" /><br />

        <label for="dataCollection">Data Collection:</label>
        <textarea id="dataCollection" required="" rows="4"></textarea><br />

        <label for="dataUsage">Data Usage:</label>
        <textarea id="dataUsage" required="" rows="4"></textarea><br />

        <button onclick="generatePrivacyPolicy()" type="button">Generate Privacy Policy</button>
    </form>

    <div id="privacyPolicy"></div>

    <script>
        function generatePrivacyPolicy() {
            const websiteName = document.getElementById("websiteName").value;
            const websiteURL = document.getElementById("websiteURL").value;
            const contactEmail = document.getElementById("contactEmail").value;
            const dataCollection = document.getElementById("dataCollection").value;
            const dataUsage = document.getElementById("dataUsage").value;

            const privacyPolicy = `
                <h2>Privacy Policy for ${websiteName}</h2>
                <p>At ${websiteName}, accessible from ${websiteURL}, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by ${websiteName} and how we use it.</p>

                <h3>Contact Information</h3>
                <p>If you have any questions or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at ${contactEmail}.</p>

                <h3>Data Collection</h3>
                <p>${dataCollection}</p>

                <h3>Data Usage</h3>
                <p>${dataUsage}</p>
            `;

            document.getElementById("privacyPolicy").innerHTML = privacyPolicy;
        }
    </script>
</body>
</html>

Note:- This code is only a basic code . you can customize it according to your needs

link.title: Html code to create privacy policy generator website

entry.title: How to Create a unique template for your blogger site
entry.content:
Creating a unique template for your Blogger blog involves customizing the design and layout to make it stand out. Here's a basic example of an HTML and CSS template that you can use as a starting point. You can further customize it to suit your brand and preferences:

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <title>Your Blog Title</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
            background-color: #f7f7f7;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
        }
        header {
            background-color: #333;
            color: #fff;
            padding: 20px;
            text-align: center;
        }
        header h1 {
            font-size: 36px;
            margin: 0;
        }
        nav {
            background-color: #444;
            padding: 10px;
            text-align: center;
        }
        nav a {
            text-decoration: none;
            color: #fff;
            margin: 10px;
            font-weight: bold;
        }
        .content {
            max-width: 800px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 20px;
            background-color: #fff;
            box-shadow: 0 0 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        }
        .post {
            margin-bottom: 30px;
        }
        .post h2 {
            font-size: 24px;
        }
        .post p {
            line-height: 1.6;
        }
        footer {
            background-color: #333;
            color: #fff;
            padding: 10px;
            text-align: center;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <header>
        <h1>Your Blog Name</h1>
    </header>
    <nav>
        <a href="#">Home</a>
        <a href="#">About</a>
        <a href="#">Blog</a>
        <a href="#">Contact</a>
    </nav>
    <div class="content">
        <div class="post">
            <h2>Blog Post Title 1</h2>
            <p>This is the content of your blog post. Write something interesting here.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="post">
            <h2>Blog Post Title 2</h2>
            <p>Another engaging blog post. Share your thoughts and ideas with your readers.</p>
        </div>
    </div>
    <footer>
        © 2023 Your Blog Name
    </footer>
</body>
</html>
```

To use this template:

1. Copy the HTML and CSS code provided above.

2. Log in to your Blogger dashboard.

3. Go to "Theme" and click on "Edit HTML."

4. Replace your existing template code with the code you copied.

5. Save your template.

6. Customize the template further by modifying the HTML and CSS to fit your blog's specific needs and style.

link.title: How to Create a unique template for your blogger site

entry.title: Advancements in technology
entry.content:
Introduction

In today's rapidly evolving world, advancements in technology continue to transform our lives at an unprecedented pace. From the way we communicate and work to the possibilities in healthcare and beyond, technology has become an integral part of our existence. In this blog post, we'll explore some of the remarkable advancements in technology that are shaping our future and changing the way we live and work.

1. Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) have been at the forefront of technological innovation. These technologies are enabling computers to perform tasks that used to be exclusively within the realm of human intelligence. AI is now used in applications such as virtual assistants, autonomous vehicles, and predictive analytics. ML algorithms are making strides in healthcare, finance, and marketing, revolutionizing decision-making processes.

2. 5G Technology

The rollout of 5G technology has brought faster and more reliable wireless communication. With increased bandwidth and reduced latency, 5G is poised to revolutionize various industries. It will power the Internet of Things (IoT), autonomous vehicles, augmented and virtual reality applications, and much more. 5G's impact on telemedicine and remote work is particularly noteworthy, as it enables seamless and high-quality connections, even in remote areas.

3. Quantum Computing

Quantum computing is on the horizon, promising to solve complex problems that classical computers struggle with. Unlike classical bits, which can be either 0 or 1, quantum bits (qubits) can exist in multiple states simultaneously. This allows quantum computers to perform calculations at speeds that were previously unimaginable. Quantum computing could have groundbreaking applications in cryptography, drug discovery, and climate modeling.

4. Renewable Energy Technologies

Advancements in renewable energy technologies are crucial in addressing climate change. Solar panels and wind turbines have become more efficient and affordable, making renewable energy sources more accessible. Energy storage solutions, such as advanced battery technologies, are also advancing rapidly, enabling the integration of renewable energy into the power grid on a larger scale.

5. Biotechnology and Genomics

The field of biotechnology and genomics is unlocking new possibilities in healthcare, agriculture, and beyond. CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing technology is revolutionizing genetic engineering, offering the potential to treat genetic diseases and enhance crop yields. Personalized medicine, informed by genomics, is becoming a reality, allowing for more precise and effective medical treatments.

6. Space Exploration

Advancements in technology are propelling us further into the cosmos. Private space companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin are pushing the boundaries of space travel, making it more accessible. Technologies developed for space exploration have spin-off applications on Earth, from advanced materials to improved telecommunications.

Conclusion

The continuous advancements in technology are not only transforming the way we live but also opening up new possibilities for the future. From AI and 5G to quantum computing and renewable energy, these innovations are reshaping industries, creating new jobs, and improving the quality of life. As we move forward, it is essential to consider the ethical and societal implications of these technologies, ensuring that they benefit all of humanity.

Embracing and understanding these advancements in technology will be crucial for individuals, businesses, and governments to thrive in the ever-changing landscape of the 21st century. As we stand on the cusp of even more remarkable innovations, it's an exciting time to be part of this technological revolution.

entry.title: How to delete Google account
entry.content:
To delete your Google account, follow these steps:

1. Backup Your Data: Before deleting your Google account, make sure to back up any important data, such as emails, contacts, and files, that you want to keep. You can use Google Takeout to download your data.

2. Sign in to your Google Account: Go to the Google Account settings page: https://myaccount.google.com/

3. Data & Personalization: Click on "Data & Personalization" in the left sidebar.

4. Delete a service or your account: Under the "Download, delete, or make a plan for your data" section, click on "Delete a service or your account."

5. Delete your Google Account: You'll see options for deleting specific Google services or the entire Google Account. Click "Delete your account."

6. Sign In Again: You'll be prompted to sign in to your account for security reasons.

7. Review Your Data: Carefully review the information on this page, which explains what you're deleting. Make sure to read and understand the consequences of deleting your account.

8. Confirm Your Password: Enter your password when prompted.

9. Delete Account: Click "Next," and then click "Delete Account." Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the process.

Please note that deleting your Google account will result in the loss of access to all Google services associated with that account, including Gmail, Google Drive, and any purchased content. Make sure to back up any data you want to keep and be aware of the consequences before proceeding.

The Samsung Galaxy S23 is the latest flagship smartphone from the tech giant. It features a 6.7-inch Infinity-O display, a powerful Exynos 990 processor, and a triple-camera setup. With its sleek design and powerful specs, the Galaxy S23 is sure to be a hit with tech enthusiasts.

Here's a closer look at the features of the Galaxy S23:

Heading

Powerful Exynos 990 Processor: Enjoy smooth and fast performance with the Exynos 990 processor.

Triple-Camera Setup: Capture stunning photos and videos with the Galaxy S23's triple-camera setup.

List

5G Connectivity: Enjoy blazing-fast 5G speeds with the Galaxy S23.

IP68 Water and Dust Resistance: The Galaxy S23 is IP68 certified, so it can withstand water and dust.

Wireless PowerShare: Charge other devices wirelessly with the Galaxy S23's Wireless PowerShare feature.

FAQ

Q: Does the Galaxy S23 have a headphone jack?

A: Yes, the Galaxy S23 has a 3.5mm headphone jack.

Q: Does the Galaxy S23 have an expandable storage option?

A: Yes, the Galaxy S23 has a microSD card slot for expandable storage.

Conclusion

The Samsung Galaxy S23 is a powerful and feature-packed smartphone. It has a 6.7-inch Infinity-O display, a powerful Exynos 990 processor, and a triple-camera setup. It also has 5G connectivity, IP68 water and dust resistance, and Wireless PowerShare. With its sleek design and powerful specs, the Galaxy S23 is sure to be a hit with tech enthusiasts.

entry.title: 5G growth in india
entry.content:
5G growth in India


(Image - getty images)

India is one of the fastest growing markets for 5G technology, with a projected compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 63.4% from 2020 to 2026. The country is expected to have over 350 million 5G subscribers by 2026, accounting for about 27% of the total mobile subscriptions. The main drivers for 5G adoption in India are the increasing demand for high-speed data, the proliferation of smart devices, the emergence of new use cases such as internet of things (IoT), cloud computing, artificial intelligence (AI), and augmented reality (AR) / virtual reality (VR), and the government's initiatives to promote digital transformation and innovation. 

Some of the key challenges for 5G deployment in India are the high cost of spectrum, the lack of infrastructure readiness, the regulatory uncertainties, and the security and privacy concerns. However, these challenges can be overcome by adopting a collaborative approach among the stakeholders, including the government, the telecom operators, the equipment vendors, the application developers, and the end users. 5G technology has the potential to transform various sectors of the Indian economy, such as agriculture, healthcare, education, manufacturing, and entertainment, by enabling new services and applications that can enhance productivity, efficiency, quality, and customer experience. 

5G can also contribute to the social and environmental goals of the country, such as bridging the digital divide, empowering women and marginalized groups, reducing carbon emissions, and improving public safety and disaster management. Therefore, 5G is not just a technology upgrade, but a strategic opportunity for India to leapfrog into the next era of digital development and competitiveness.

entry.title: The Highly Anticipated Samsung Galaxy S24: What to Expect
entry.content:
The Highly Anticipated Samsung Galaxy S24: What to Expect

The Samsung Galaxy S24 is one of the most highly anticipated smartphones of the year. With the success of the S21 and the recent release of the S22, Samsung fans are eagerly awaiting the next iteration of the popular flagship device.

But what can we expect from the Samsung Galaxy S24? In this article, well dive into the rumors and predictions surrounding the release date, features, and design of the S24.

Samsung Galaxy S24 Release Date

by Samsung Memory (https://unsplash.com/@samsungmemory)

The release date for the Samsung Galaxy S24 is still unknown, but based on previous release patterns, we can make an educated guess.

Samsung typically releases their flagship devices in the first quarter of the year, with the S21 being released in January 2021 and the S22 in February 2022. This leads us to believe that the S24 will be released in January or February of 2023.

However, there have been rumors that Samsung may change their release schedule and release the S24 in the second half of 2023. This could be due to the ongoing chip shortage and supply chain issues that have affected the tech industry.

Regardless of the exact release date, we can expect the Samsung Galaxy S24 to be available for purchase in early 2023.

Design and Display

by Florian Klauer (https://unsplash.com/@florianklauer)

The design of the Samsung Galaxy S24 is expected to be similar to its predecessors, with a few notable changes.

Rumors suggest that the S24 will have a smaller punch-hole camera, similar to the one found on the S21. This will allow for a larger display and a more immersive viewing experience.

There have also been rumors that the S24 will have an under-display camera, meaning that the front-facing camera will be hidden under the screen. This would eliminate the need for a punch-hole or notch, resulting in a truly bezel-less display.

In terms of display, the S24 is expected to have a 6.7-inch Dynamic AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. This will provide a smooth and responsive experience for users.

Camera and Features

by Federico Beccari (https://unsplash.com/@federize)

The camera is always a major selling point for Samsungs flagship devices, and the S24 is no exception.

Rumors suggest that the S24 will have a triple-lens rear camera, with a 108MP main sensor, a 12MP ultra-wide sensor, and a 12MP telephoto sensor. This will allow for high-quality photos and videos, even in low light conditions.

There have also been rumors that the S24 will have a periscope lens, similar to the one found on the S21 Ultra. This would allow for even greater zoom capabilities, making the S24 a top choice for photography enthusiasts.

In terms of features, the S24 is expected to have an improved fingerprint scanner, possibly using ultrasonic technology. It may also have an improved facial recognition system, making it easier and more secure to unlock the device.

Performance and Battery Life

by Bryan Goff (https://unsplash.com/@bryangoffphoto)

The Samsung Galaxy S24 is expected to have top-of-the-line performance, thanks to its powerful processor and ample RAM.

Rumors suggest that the S24 will have a Snapdragon 895 or Exynos 2200 processor, depending on the region. It is also expected to have 12GB of RAM, providing smooth and efficient multitasking.

In terms of battery life, the S24 is rumored to have a 5,000mAh battery, which is slightly larger than the S21s 4,000mAh battery. This, combined with the efficient processor, should provide all-day battery life for most users.

Price

by Mink Mingle (https://unsplash.com/@minkmingle)

The price of the Samsung Galaxy S24 is still unknown, but we can make an educated guess based on previous releases.

The S21 was released at $799, while the S22 was released at $899. This leads us to believe that the S24 will be priced at around $999. However, if Samsung decides to release the S24 in the second half of 2023, the price may be affected by market conditions and could potentially be higher.

Samsung S24 vs. Other Flagship Devices

by Samsung Memory (https://unsplash.com/@samsungmemory)

The Samsung Galaxy S24 will be competing with other flagship devices from major brands such as Apple, Google, and OnePlus. So how does it stack up against the competition?

In terms of design, the S24 is expected to have a similar design to its predecessors, while the iPhone 14 is rumored to have a completely new design with a punch-hole camera. The Google Pixel 7 is also expected to have a punch-hole camera, while the OnePlus 10 may have an under-display camera.

In terms of camera, the S24 is expected to have a triple-lens rear camera, while the iPhone 14 is rumored to have a quad-lens camera. The Google Pixel 7 is expected to have a dual-lens camera, while the OnePlus 10 may have a triple-lens camera.

In terms of performance, the S24 is expected to have a powerful processor and ample RAM, similar to the other flagship devices. However, the iPhone 14 is rumored to have a new A16 chip, which could potentially outperform the S24.

Conclusion

The Samsung Galaxy S24 is shaping up to be an impressive flagship device, with top-of-the-line features and performance. While the exact release date and price are still unknown, we can expect the S24 to be released in early 2023 and priced at around $999.

With its sleek design, powerful camera, and impressive performance, the Samsung Galaxy S24 is sure to be a top choice for smartphone users. Keep an eye out for more updates and announcements as we get closer to the release date.

link.title: The Highly Anticipated Samsung Galaxy S24: What to Expect

entry.title: Five tips for Extending mobile battery life
entry.content:
Top 5 Tips for Extending Mobile Battery Life

In today's fast-paced world, our mobile devices have become an essential part of our daily lives. From staying connected with loved ones to managing our work and personal schedules, our mobile phones are always by our side. However, with constant use, our mobile batteries can quickly drain, leaving us stranded without a way to communicate or access important information. To avoid this inconvenience, here are the top five tips for extending your mobile battery life.

Adjust Screen Brightness

by Markus Spiske (https://unsplash.com/@markusspiske)

One of the biggest drains on your mobile battery is the screen brightness. By default, most mobile devices have their screen brightness set to the highest level, which can quickly drain your battery. To conserve battery life, try adjusting your screen brightness to a lower level. You can also enable the auto-brightness feature, which will adjust the brightness according to the lighting in your surroundings.

Close Unused Apps

Many of us have a habit of leaving multiple apps open on our mobile devices, even when we are not using them. However, these apps continue to run in the background, consuming battery life. To extend your mobile battery life, make sure to close any unused apps. You can also enable the "background app refresh" feature, which will prevent apps from refreshing in the background and draining your battery.

Turn Off Location Services

Location services are a useful feature that allows apps to access your location for various purposes. However, constantly using your device's GPS can significantly drain your battery. To conserve battery life, turn off location services for apps that do not require it. You can also enable the "low power mode" feature, which will automatically turn off location services when your battery is low.

Use Wi-Fi Instead of Data

Using data on your mobile device can quickly drain your battery. To conserve battery life, try using Wi-Fi whenever possible. Not only is Wi-Fi faster and more reliable, but it also consumes less battery power. You can also turn off your data when you are not using it to prevent unnecessary battery drain.

Invest in a High-Quality Battery

by Caspar Camille Rubin (https://unsplash.com/@casparrubin)

If you find that your mobile battery is constantly draining, it may be time to invest in a new one. When purchasing a new battery, make sure to buy from a reputable source, such as Batteries Plus Mobile AL. A high-quality battery will not only last longer but also provide better performance, saving you money in the long run.

By following these top five tips, you can extend the life of your mobile battery and avoid the inconvenience of a dead phone. Remember to adjust your screen brightness, close unused apps, turn off location services, use Wi-Fi instead of data, and invest in a high-quality battery. With these simple steps, you can ensure that your mobile device is always ready when you need it.

Do you have any other tips for extending mobile battery life? Share them with us in the comments below.

link.title: Five tips for Extending mobile battery life

entry.title: The Marvels of Applied Science: Solving Real-World Problems
entry.content:
The Marvels of Applied Science: Solving Real-World Problems

Applied science is the practical application of scientific knowledge to solve real-world problems. It is a field that combines theoretical knowledge with practical skills to create innovative solutions for everyday challenges. From developing new technologies to improving existing processes, applied science plays a crucial role in shaping our world. In this article, we will explore the wonders of applied science and the various career opportunities it offers.

What is Applied Science?

Applied science is a branch of science that focuses on the practical application of scientific principles and theories. It involves using scientific knowledge to solve real-world problems and improve existing processes. This field encompasses a wide range of disciplines, including engineering, technology, healthcare, and environmental science. Applied science is often contrasted with pure science, which focuses on theoretical research and the pursuit of knowledge for its own sake.

The Marvels of Applied Functional Science

by National Cancer Institute (https://unsplash.com/@nci)

Applied functional science is a specialized branch of applied science that focuses on the human body's movement and function. It combines biomechanics, anatomy, and physiology to analyze how the body moves and how it can be optimized for better performance. This field is particularly useful in sports and rehabilitation, where understanding the body's mechanics is crucial for preventing injuries and improving performance. Applied functional science is also used in ergonomics, physical therapy, and occupational therapy.

Career Opportunities in Applied Science

The field of applied science offers a wide range of career opportunities for individuals with a passion for science and problem-solving. Some of the most popular jobs in this field include:

Environmental Scientist

Environmental scientists use their knowledge of science and the environment to develop solutions for environmental problems. They may work on projects related to pollution control, waste management, or conservation. A degree in applied science, with a focus on environmental science, is typically required for this role.

Biomedical Engineer

Biomedical engineers use their knowledge of biology, medicine, and engineering to develop new medical devices and technologies. They may work on projects related to prosthetics, medical imaging, or drug delivery systems. A degree in applied science, with a focus on biomedical engineering, is typically required for this role.

Quality Control Technician

Quality control technicians are responsible for ensuring that products and processes meet quality standards. They use scientific methods to test and analyze products and identify any defects or issues. A degree in applied science, with a focus on quality control, is typically required for this role.

Associate of Applied Science Jobs

An associate of applied science (AAS) degree is a two-year program that prepares students for entry-level positions in various fields of applied science. Some popular AAS jobs include dental hygienist, radiologic technologist, and veterinary technician. These roles offer a great starting point for individuals looking to kickstart their career in applied science.

Conclusion

Applied science is a fascinating field that offers endless opportunities for individuals with a passion for science and problem-solving. From developing new technologies to improving existing processes, applied science plays a crucial role in shaping our world. Whether you are interested in environmental science, engineering, or healthcare, there is a career in applied science waiting for you. So, if you have a curious mind and a desire to make a difference, consider pursuing a career in applied science.

link.title: The Marvels of Applied Science: Solving Real-World Problems

entry.title: How to update Email-id in vodafone idea app
entry.content:
Vodafone idea offers data benefits and unlimited calls benefits at affordable plans starts from RS 99.    Vodafone idea is a joint venture between vodafone and idea.now you can easily change your email-id in vi app. Email-id is the best medium for company to contact you for any issues you have with their network and you can get otp through email in order to access vi app( This option is not for enterprises) . here are some steps you have to follow in order to update your email-id.

2) Click on my account

8) Now you will recieve confirmation that your service request no 198898999(This is example only ) in 2 hours

entry.title: How to add website in google search console?
entry.content:
How to add website in google search console?

Google search console monitors your website and helps you to reach your users.In google search console adding website is an easy thing. but you have to follow several instructions.

Instructions :-

1 Url / domain must be entered without any / slash at the beginning and at the end of the url.

2 Domain must be like this sample.com or sample.tech etc.

3 You have to verify Dns in your domain provider admin panel.

After entering your website domain or url you have verify dns by entering host and destination in c name or txt.

For example:- host- www and destination-ghs.google .com

After verifying dns your website or project will be added to search console.

Submit your website sitemap that will be helpfull for search console to crawl your website pages.

Whats special

Special thing about google search console is it helps for growth of our website by publishing our website and its pages across the world.

link.title: How to add website in google search console?

entry.title: How to setup jio true 5G in Samsung A14 5G
entry.content:
(Images - Both images are from web)
Samsung galaxy A14 5G is samsung's best budget 5G smartphone after galaxy M13 5G and M14 5G . Most of the people facing issues regarding Jio true 5G issues. Here we are gonna provide some easy steps to setup true 5G network in Galaxy A14 5G.
1) Open settings

2) Click on connections

3) Select 5G/LTE/4G/Auto connect

4) Click on mobile networks

5) Scan networks 

6) or else try to deregister your jio network and register it again there you can find jioTrue5G click on that.

7) Try to reset Apn 

8) Don't change Apn

9) Apn should be Jio4G only 

10) Now enjoy unlimited 5G.

11) Remember: recharge your number at Rs 239 and above not below Rs 239.

entry.content:
Kodi is a free and open-source media player software application developed by the XBMC Foundation, a non-profit technology consortium. Kodi is available for multiple operating systems and hardware platforms, with a software 10-foot user interface for use with televisions and remote controls

Steps to install addon

1) Open kodi app or software

2) Click on install addons option

3) Extract the zip file

4) Search the folder where you have pasted the extracted zip file

5) Click on it 

6) Click on install from repository

7) In few seconds addon will be installed

Download the file
